intro: Elatostema laciniatum var. platyphyllum, commonly known as the broad-leafed elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and distinctive, lobed leaves. The leaves are typically broad and have a velvety texture, which helps in identifying the plant. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the year, contributing to its ornamental value.
